name: machiavellianism
content:

the use of clever but often dishonest methods that deceive people in order to win power or control: Saying that scientists misinform the press suggests a Machiavellianism that is hard to support. a tale of business-world Machiavellianism See
Machiavellian
More examplesFewer examplesSuch concepts as integrity and comradeship are cherished and others, like Machiavellianism, despised. Research suggest conflict between parents is associated with higher levels of Machiavellianism in boys. Psychologists believe people who like the bitter taste of black coffee or dark chocolate are more likely to show signs of narcissism and Machiavellianism.
